description: This crash occurred on the eastbound lanes of an undivided four-lane roadway with two lanes in each direction.  The roadway was straight and level, and it was daylight and clear with no adverse conditions.  The speed limit for the roadway was 48 kmph (30 mph).Vehicle #1 was a 1996 Lincoln Town Car that was in the eastbound parking lane and attempting to make a U-turn to go westbound on the roadway.  Vehicle #2 was a Dodge Grand Caravan that was traveling eastbound in the second lane of travel.  Vehicle #1 attempted to make a U-turn and the front impacted the right side of Vehicle #2.The Lincoln Town Car (Vehicle #1) was driven by a 37-year old male who did not sustain any injuries.  The driver stated that he was coming out of a parking spot and attempting to make a U-Turn.  Vehicle #1 was used and registered as a livery cab and was driven away from the scene.

The crash occurred in the northbound lane of a T-intersection with a grass median.  There was one northbound left-turn only lane with a traffic control and two eastbound lanes with the same traffic control signal.  Conditions were overcast with rain with light fog in the early afternoon of a weekday.  The roadway had a posted speed of 45 MPH.     Vehicle 1 was a 1988 Mercedes Benz 300SL stopped for the traffic control intending on turning left.  Vehicle 2 was a 2002 Mercury Mountaineer driving eastbound in the right lane approaching the traffic control.  The light for the Mercedes turned green and the vehicle started turning left when the front of the Mercury struck the left-front corner of the Mercedes.  The Mercedes rotated CCW 90 degrees and the vehicle's final rest was facing east in the eastbound lane.  Final rest for the Mercury was facing east in the eastbound lane as well.

The crash occurred in the intersection of a five-lane roadway controlled by a traffic control signal.  Conditions were dark with minimal lighting in the evening on a weekday.  The posted speed limit was 80 KMPH (50 MPH).  The northbound lane had a  >2% uphill grade.  The southbound lane was level.     V1 was a 1999 Toyota Corolla sedan traveling northbound in the third travel lane approaching an intersection controlled by a traffic control signal intending on turning left at the intersection.  V2, a 2006 Chevy Colorado pickup, was traveling southbound in the 2nd travel lane approaching the same intersection intending on going straight.  The front of V1 struck the front of V2 in the intersection.  Both vehicles came to final rest facing southbound.     V1 was driven by a 51-year-old male who sustained moderate injuries and was transported to a local hospital.  He stated that he did not see V2.  The driver did not take any avoidance actions and was traveling between 11-20 MPH at the time of impact.  V1 was towed due to damage.

This crash occurred on a dry 2 lane loose dirt-gravel roadway on a weekday night.  The speed limit was 40kmph (25mph) and there was a grade of 8.2%.  The roadway was curved at the point of impact with a hillside obscuring the view of the two drivers.	Vehicle 1 was negotiating and uphill right hand curve.  Vehicle 2 was proceeding opposite vehicle1 and negotiating a downhill left hand curve.  The driver of Vehicle 1 pulled over and stopped the driver of Vehicle 2 crossed over and stuck Vehicle 1's left front with V2's left front.  	Vehicle 1 was a 1993 Cadillac Seville driven by a 45 year old male.  The driver states he was going around the bend when he saw another car coming the opposite way, he stopped and the other car hit him in the door.
